Present, Future Giving                                          Home / Academics / Honors Program                         Honors Program                                                             Dean's Welcome                       Welcome from the Associate Dean of Undergraduate Academics   As a member of the School of Engineering's Honors Program you will be a part of an educational experience in an academically challenging surrounding that actively fosters both critical thinking and creativity in the sciences and technology. You will be joining the School of Engineering in its mission of i2e - invention, innovation and entrepreneurship - and we know that you will be a valuable addition to this vision of the future.   Your curricular and extra-curricular life at the School of Engineering will build a strong foundation upon which you can build your professional life. To that end, we invite you to take advantage of all the resources the School of Engineering has to offer its undergraduates during your time here - from completing publishable research with faculty to finding inspiration from the robust culture of New York City.   You will be a part of a select cohort of students who promise to become some of the country's leading thinkers, scientists and engineers. We welcome you to this exciting and innovative journey!   Regards,   Iraj Kalkhoran, Associate Dean of Undergraduate Academics and Acting Director of the Honors Program   Mission Overview   The Honors Program serves as a magnet for attracting academically superior undergraduates to the School of Engineering. It accepts students of exceptional talent and promise from a variety of backgrounds. Honors Program students have the opportunity to work one-on-one with faculty mentors, who, among other things, stress interdisciplinary research, originality of thought and active learning. Honors Program students form a talented cadre of high-achievers who will become engineers, scientists, managers and other professionals positioned for leadership roles in our emerging knowledge-based economy. They will also form a highly enthusiastic and supportive part of the University's alumni population and enhance the overall reputation of the University for delivering excellence in education.   Building on a Distinguished Heritage   The Honors Program is built on a strong heritage. Approximately three decades ago the School of Engineering had an Honors Program which graduated a number of very distinguished alumni. Some of these Honors Program graduates are now on the School of Engineering faculty, while others have joined the faculties of other universities across the country and some have become leaders in corporations, government, research and development and the public sector. Many of these alumni are also successful entrepreneurs. Hence, the new Honors Program is anchored, albeit in a Twenty-First Century mode, on a unique and robust foundation.     Office of the President                       Deans and Directors                       Senior Administration                       University Senate                       President-Designate                                                                   Deans and Directors      Roger Bagnall, BA, MA, PhD   Director, Institute for the Study of the Ancient World   The Institute for the Study of the Ancient World is a center for advanced scholarly research and graduate education aimed to encourage the study of the economic, religious, political and cultural connections between ancient civilizations. ISAW is a discrete entity within NYU, with its own endowment and its own board of trustees.   Gérard Ben Arous, BS, MSc, PhD   Director, Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences; Vice Provost for Science and Engineering Development  The Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences is a center for research and advanced training in mathematics and computer science. It hosts NYU's department of mathematics and computer science and the Center for Atmosphere-Ocean Science.   Lauren Benton, BA, PhD   Dean, Graduate School of Arts and Science  The Graduate School of Arts and Science grants advanced degrees, including doctorates, master's and certificates, in a wide range of disciplines spanning the humanities, social, natural and physical sciences.   Charles N. Bertolami, DDS, DMedSc   Herman Robert Fox Dean, College of Dentistry  The College of Dentistry offers pre- and postdoctoral programs in dentistry and dental hygiene, as well as several MS programs and a PhD program in epidemiology in collaboration with Columbia, Johns Hopkins, and Yale Universities. The NYU College of Nursing, part of the College of Dentistry, offers degrees and advanced certificates in nursing.   Alfred H. Bloom, BA, PhD; hon.: LLD   Vice Chancellor, New York University Abu Dhabi  NYU Abu Dhabi is a research university with a fully integrated liberal arts and science college. Through its NYU Abu Dhabi Institute, it is a world-class center of cutting-edge research, scholarship, and cultural activity.     Dominic Brewer, BA, MA, PhD   Gale and Ira Drukier Dean, Steinhardt School for Culture, Education, and Human Development   The Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development's undergraduate and graduate programs provide students with a professional education in the areas of health, education, communication, art, music and the arts professions.     Thomas J. Carew, BA, MA, PhD; hon.: MA   Anne and Joel Ehrenkranz Dean, Faculty of Arts and Science  The Faculty of Arts and Science design curricula and teaching in both the College of Arts and Science (CAS) and the Graduate School of Arts and Science (GSAS), linking undergraduate and graduate education with training and research rooted in the humanities, social, natural and physical sciences.   Joy Connolly, BA, PhD   Dean for Humanities, Faculty of Arts and Science  The Office of the Dean for Humanities, under the Faculty of Arts and Science, develops academic strategy and maintains academic excellence in the humanities programs in the College of Arts and Science (CAS) and the Graduate School of Arts and Science (GSAS).        Dennis DiLorenzo , BA   Harvey J. Stedman Dean, School of Professional Studies   The School of Professional Studies offers undergraduate, graduate, and continuing education programs in professional and career-focused study. SCPS also has a number of diploma and certificate programs for professional training.        Sherry A. Glied , BA, MA, PhD   Dean, Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service  The Wagner Graduate School of Public Service offers advanced programs in public service and public policy. Wagner offers undergraduate courses and joint minors with other NYU schools, several master's programs, a doctoral program and dual degrees in conjunction with other schools at the University.          Allyson Green, BFA, MFA   Dean, Tisch School of the Arts  Tisch School of the Arts is one of the world’s leading centers of undergraduate and graduate study in the performing and cinematic arts. The school is comprised of 17 departments and programs offering the BA, BFA, MFA, MA, MPS, and PhD degrees.        Robert I. Grossman , BS, MD   Saul J. Farber Dean, NYU School of Medicine; Chief Executive Officer, NYU Hospitals Center  The NYU School of Medicine is an integrated academic medical center, offering M.D., Ph.D., M.D./Ph.D., M.S., continuing medical education, residency and fellowship programs. The NYU Hospitals Center comprises Tisch Hospital, the Rusk Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine and the NYU Hospital for Joint Diseases.        Cheryl G. Healton , BA, MPA, DrPH   Director, Global Institute of Public Health; Dean of Global Public Health  The Global Institute of Public Health is a university-wide endeavor supporting innovative public health education and collaborative research worldwide. Drawing from resources across NYU’s schools, the Institute offers interdisciplinary public health education at the undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral levels.          Peter Blair Henry , BA, BA, PhD   Dean, Leonard N. Stern School of Business   The Leonard N. Stern School of Business is a management education school and business center, offering undergraduate and graduate level programs in business and management education. Along with the London School of Economics and the HEC School of Management, Paris, Stern is part of the TRIUM Global Executive MBA program.        Michael Laver, BA (hons.), MA, PhD   Dean for Social Sciences, Faculty of Arts and Science  The Office of the Dean for Social Sciences, under the Faculty of Arts and Science, develops academic strategy and maintains academic excellence in social science programs in the College of Arts and Science (CAS) and the Graduate School of Arts and Science (GSAS).          Jeffrey S. Lehman , BA, JD, MPP   Vice Chancellor, NYU Shanghai  NYU Shanghai is the third degree-granting campus in NYU's global network. It is a world-class, comprehensive four-year liberal arts and science research university. The first class entered in Fall 2013.          Carol A. Mandel , BA, MA, MSLS   Dean of Libraries   The Office of the Dean of Libraries oversees NYU's libraries, media services, university archives and the NYU Press.        Geeta Menon , BS, MA, PhD   Dean, Undergraduate College, Leonard N. Stern School of Business  The undergraduate program at the Leonard N. Stern School of Business combines business fundamentals with the liberal arts, and prepares students to be socially responsible, global leaders and thinkers for the 21st century.        Trevor Morrison , BA, JD   Dean, School of Law  The School of Law is a center for advanced law study, offering J.D. degrees and a number of dual degree programs with other graduate schools at the University. Among its programs, the School of Law has 10 areas of focus for students to explore.          Michael D. Purugganan , BS, MA, PhD   Dean for Science, Faculty of Arts and Science  The Office of the Dean for Science, under the Faculty of Arts and Science, develops academic strategy and maintains academic excellence in science programs in the College of Arts and Science (CAS) and the Graduate School of Arts and Science (GSAS).          Paul Romer, BS, PhD   Director, Marron Institute of Urban Management   The Marron Institute deepens the fundamental understanding of cities by working with civic innovators to improve urban management.        Patricia Lee Rubin , BA, MA, PhD   Judy and Michael Steinhardt Director, Institute of Fine Arts  The Institute of Fine Arts is a center for graduate teaching and advanced research in the history of art, archaeology and the conservation and technology of works of art. The Institute offers degrees of Master of Arts and Doctor of Philosophy, an Advanced Certificate in Conservation of Works of Art and Certificate in Curatorial Studies issued jointly with the Metropolitan Museum of Art.          Fred Schwarzbach , BA, MA, PhD   Dean of Liberal Studies  The Liberal Studies Program is a two-year foundation program for students who will complete their education in one of the university's other undergraduate schools. It features an interdisciplinary core curriculum that fulfills the liberal arts requirements for bachelor's degrees in NYU's other schools.          Katepalli R. Sreenivasan , BE, ME, MA, PhD; hon.:DSc   Dean, Polytechnic School of Engineering; Executive Vice Provost for Engineering and Applied Sciences  The NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering is a comprehensive school of engineering, applied sciences, technology and research. The institution, founded in 1854, is the nation’s second-oldest private engineering school.          G. Gabrielle Starr , BA, MA, PhD   Seryl Kushner Dean, College of Arts and Science  The College of Arts and Science provides undergraduate programs in liberal arts study. In addition to majors and minors in the humanities, social, natural and physical sciences, CAS offers various pre-professional and inter-school programs.          Eileen Sullivan-Marx , BSN, MS, PhD, CRNP, RN, FAAN   Dean, College of Nursing  The College of Nursing educates future nursing professionals who demonstrate the highest standards of excellence in research, education, and practice. The College offers bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees, as well as advanced certificate programs.        Lynn Videka , BSN, MA, PhD   Dean, Silver School of Social Work  The Silver School of Social Work is a center for the education of professional social workers, offering undergraduate, master's and doctoral degrees. Students study at NYU's Washington Square campus, at Sarah Lawrence College, the College of Staten Island and St. Thomas Aquinas College.     Susanne L. Wofford , BA; BPhil [Oxon], PhD   Dean, Gallatin School of Individualized Study  The Gallatin School of Individualized Study gives students the opportunity to design a program of study tailored to their own needs and interests. Undergraduate and master's studies are conducted in conjunction with other University schools and programs.        Yu Lizhong , BSc, PhD   Chancellor, NYU Shanghai  NYU Shanghai is the third degree-granting campus in NYU's global network. It is a world-class, comprehensive four-year liberal arts and science research university. The first class entered in Fall 2013.
